alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 6:00PM MDT until August 28 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The McBride burn scar in... South Central Lincoln County in central New Mexico... * Until 800 PM MDT. * At 600 PM MDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the McBride Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Gavilan Canyon Road particularly near the south end of Gavilan Canyon Road near the junction with Meander, Homestead Loop and downstream to the Rio Ruidoso. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the McBride Burn Scar. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the McBride Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs and Hollywood. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the McBride fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
